com.hiddenswitch.spellsource

Interface Games

  • All Superinterfaces:
    io.vertx.core.Verticle

    public interface Games
extends io.vertx.core.Verticle
    A service that starts a game session, accepts connections from players and manages the state of the game.

    Various static methods convert game data into a format the Unity3D client can understand.

      • getClientActions

                                                                               java.util.List<GameAction> actions,
                                                                               int playerId)
        Get a client's view of the current game actions.
        Parameters:
        workingContext - A game context that contains the players and state.
        actions - The possible actions ot process against the context.
        playerId - The player to process actions for.
        Returns:
        A list of game client actions.

      • buildChooseOneOptions

        static <T extends PlayCardAction & HasChoiceCard> com.hiddenswitch.spellsource.client.models.ChooseOneOptions buildChooseOneOptions(GameContext workingContext,
                                                                                                                                    int playerId,
                                                                                                                                    int[] chooseOneVirtualEntitiesId,
                                                                                                                                    int sourceId,
                                                                                                                                    java.util.List<T> choices,
                                                                                                                                    java.util.function.BiConsumer<com.hiddenswitch.spellsource.client.models.ChooseOneOptions,com.hiddenswitch.spellsource.client.models.SpellAction> adder)
        Builds choose one options from a choice card, incrementing the chooseOneVirtualEntitiesId for every virtual entity it has added using adder.
        Type Parameters:
        T - The particular action type that supports the interface HasChoiceCard
        Parameters:
        workingContext - A GameContext to query for state.
        playerId - The point of view whom we should build the choices from.
        chooseOneVirtualEntitiesId - A single-element array whose item is used to "out" the incremented entities ID (i.e., chooseOneVirtualEntitiesId[0]++)
        sourceId - The source card's entity ID.
        choices - The list of PlayCardAction choices.
        adder - A method that accepts a SpellAction to return to the user.
        Returns:
        The choose one options.

      • getClientEvent

        static com.hiddenswitch.spellsource.client.models.GameEvent getClientEvent(GameEvent event,
                                                                           int playerId)
        Gets a client view of a game event.

        This method does not correctly consider security issues accurately. It leaks which cards the opponent draws and which secrets the opponent plays. In the future, it will respect these limitations.

        Parameters:
        event - A game engine event.
        playerId - The player requesting the view.
        Returns:
        A client-specific view of the event.

      • endGame

        static void endGame(com.hiddenswitch.spellsource.impl.GameId game)
             throws com.github.fromage.quasi.fibers.SuspendExecution,
                    java.lang.InterruptedException
        Immediately ends the given game, causing both players to concede.

        All games ended this way end in a draw.

        Parameters:
        game -
        Throws:
        com.github.fromage.quasi.fibers.SuspendExecution
        java.lang.InterruptedException

      • describeGameSession

        com.hiddenswitch.spellsource.models.DescribeGameSessionResponse describeGameSession(com.hiddenswitch.spellsource.models.DescribeGameSessionRequest request)
        Gets the current game state of a requested game ID. In the future, this method should punt the request to the next Games service instance if it can't find the given session.
        Parameters:
        request - The game ID to describe.
        Returns:
        The game state of the requested game.

      • endGameSession

        com.hiddenswitch.spellsource.models.EndGameSessionResponse endGameSession(com.hiddenswitch.spellsource.models.EndGameSessionRequest request)
                                                                   throws java.lang.InterruptedException,
                                                                          com.github.fromage.quasi.fibers.SuspendExecution
        Possibly prematurely ends the game session. Typically this is done due to timeouts or some external action that would concede a game (like a ban or profanity). This will send the correct game over notifications to the bots/ players who are connected to this game.
        Parameters:
        request - The game to end.
        Returns:
        Information about ending the specified game session.
        Throws:
        java.lang.InterruptedException
        com.github.fromage.quasi.fibers.SuspendExecution

      • updateEntity

        @Suspendable
com.hiddenswitch.spellsource.models.UpdateEntityResponse updateEntity(com.hiddenswitch.spellsource.models.UpdateEntityRequest request)
                                                                            throws java.lang.UnsupportedOperationException
        Updates an entity specified inside the game with specific attributes. Currently unsupported. This allows real-time manipulation of a game in progress. This call should punt the request to the next instance in the cluster if it does not have the specified game.
        Parameters:
        request - Information about the game and the updates to the entity this service should do.
        Returns:
        Information about the entity update.
        Throws:
        java.lang.UnsupportedOperationException

      • performGameAction

        @Suspendable
com.hiddenswitch.spellsource.models.PerformGameActionResponse performGameAction(com.hiddenswitch.spellsource.models.PerformGameActionRequest request)
                                                                                      throws java.lang.InterruptedException,
                                                                                             com.github.fromage.quasi.fibers.SuspendExecution
        Performs a game action in the specified game.
        Parameters:
        request - A request containing the ID of the game and action to perform.
        Returns:
        A response indicating the new game state.
        Throws:
        java.lang.InterruptedException
        com.github.fromage.quasi.fibers.SuspendExecution

      • concedeGameSession

        @Suspendable
com.hiddenswitch.spellsource.models.ConcedeGameSessionResponse concedeGameSession(com.hiddenswitch.spellsource.models.ConcedeGameSessionRequest request)
                                                                                        throws java.lang.InterruptedException,
                                                                                               com.github.fromage.quasi.fibers.SuspendExecution
        Concedes the specified game session. Unlike ending a game session prematurely, a concession may trigger some additional notifications and scoring consequences.
        Parameters:
        request - The player and game conceding.
        Returns:
        Any consequences of the concession.
        Throws:
        java.lang.InterruptedException
        com.github.fromage.quasi.fibers.SuspendExecution

      • getClientGameState

        default com.hiddenswitch.spellsource.client.models.GameState getClientGameState(java.lang.String gameId,
                                                                                java.lang.String userId)
        Gets a complete view of the game for the specified user, respecting security (i.e., information about the user's opponent's deck, hand and secrets is not leaked).
        Parameters:
        gameId - The game to get client state for.
        userId - The user ID whose point of view this state should be generated for.
        Returns:
        A client view game state.

      • getGameState

        static com.hiddenswitch.spellsource.client.models.GameState getGameState(GameContext workingContext,
                                                                         Player local,
                                                                         Player opponent)
        Given a context and a specification of who the local and opposing players are, generate a client game state view. This view does not leak secure information.
        Parameters:
        workingContext - A context containing the complete game state.
        local - The local player.
        opponent - The opposing player.
        Returns:
        A client view game state.

      • getEntity

        static com.hiddenswitch.spellsource.client.models.Entity getEntity(GameContext workingContext,
                                                                   Entity entity,
                                                                   int localPlayerId)
        Gets a client view of the specified game engine entity. Tries its best to not leak information given the specified user.
        Parameters:
        workingContext - A context to generate the entity view for.
        entity - The entity.
        localPlayerId - The point of view this method should use o determine which information to show the client.
        Returns:
        A client entity view.

      • getEntity

        static com.hiddenswitch.spellsource.client.models.Entity getEntity(GameContext workingContext,
                                                                   Actor actor,
                                                                   int localPlayerId)
        Gets the client's view of an actor in the game engine.
        Parameters:
        workingContext - A context to generate the entity view for.
        actor - The specified actor.
        localPlayerId - The point of view this method should use o determine which information to show the client.
        Returns:
        A client entity view.

      • getEntity

        static com.hiddenswitch.spellsource.client.models.Entity getEntity(GameContext workingContext,
                                                                   Enchantment enchantment,
                                                                   int localPlayerId)
        A view of a secret or quest. Censors information from opposing players if it's a secret.
        Parameters:
        workingContext - The context to generate the client view for.
        enchantment - The secret or quest entity. Any entity backed by a Enchantment is valid here.
        localPlayerId - The point of view this method should use o determine which information to show the client.
        Returns:
        A client entity view.

      • getEntity

        @Suspendable
static com.hiddenswitch.spellsource.client.models.Entity getEntity(GameContext workingContext,
                                                                                Card card,
                                                                                int localPlayerId)
        A view of a card. This does not censor information from opposing player's--the calling method should handle the censoring.
        Parameters:
        workingContext - The context to generate the client view for.
        card - The card entity.
        localPlayerId - The point of view this method should use o determine which information to show the client.
        Returns:
        A client entity view.

      • toClientLocation

        static com.hiddenswitch.spellsource.client.models.EntityLocation toClientLocation(EntityLocation location)
        Converts an in-game entity location to a client view location.
        Parameters:
        location - A game engine entity location.
        Returns:
        A client view entity location.

      • getDefaultNoActivityTimeout

        static long getDefaultNoActivityTimeout()
        Gets the default no activity timeout as configured across the cluster. This timeout is used to determine when to end games that have received no actions from either client connected to them.
        Returns:
        A value in milliseconds of how long to wait for an action from a client before marking a game as over due to disconnection.
